message_2:
To simplify the given logarithmic expression, first simplify the fraction inside the logarithm:

$$ \log_3 \left(\frac{27}{\sqrt[3]{81}}\right) = \log_3 \left(\frac{3^3}{3^{\frac{4}{3}}}\right) $$

Now, use the properties of exponents to simplify the expression further:

$$ \log_3 \left(\frac{3^3}{3^{\frac{4}{3}}}\right) = \log_3 \left(3^{3 - \frac{4}{3}}\right) $$

Subtract the exponents:

$$ \log_3 \left(3^{3 - \frac{4}{3}}\right) = \log_3 \left(3^{\frac{5}{3}}\right) $$

Finally, use the property of logarithms that states $\log_b(b^x) = x$:

$$ \log_3 \left(3^{\frac{5}{3}}\right) = \frac{5}{3} $$

So, the simplified logarithmic expression is:

$$ \frac{5}{3} $$
